item.title: Elections 2021: Sir Keir Starmer set to reshuffle Labour's top team
item.description: Party leader plans a major shake-up after losing elections to the Conservatives across England.

item.title: Chinese rocket debris crashes into Indian Ocean - state media
item.description: Most of the Chinese Long March-5b rocket reportedly disintegrated as it re-entered the atmosphere.

item.title: Rail disruption set to continue into next week after train cracks found
item.description: Two rail firms continue to warn passengers not to travel after cracks were found on some trains.

item.title: Election results 2021: PM calls Covid recovery summit after SNP victory
item.description: Boris Johnson tells leaders of the devolved nations people are "best served when we work together".

item.title: Wales election 2021: Labour set to form new Welsh government alone
item.description: Election result allows them to work with parties on a "case-by-case basis", a minister says.

item.title: Jerusalem: Many injured on second night of clashes
item.description: Some 90 Palestinians and at least one Israeli police officer are hurt in a further night of violence.

item.title: Kabul attack: Blasts near school leave more than 50 dead
item.description: Blasts near a Kabul school killed more than 50 people on Saturday, most of whom were girls.

item.title: Prince Michael of Kent accused of selling Kremlin access
item.description: The Queen's cousin denies he has close ties to Vladimir Putin after an undercover investigation.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'outdoor art'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers on this week's theme.

item.title: The Papers: Labour's 'civil war', and PM wants UK to 'unite'
item.description: Fallout from the nationwide elections continues to feature prominently on the front pages

item.title: Ian Cunningham: 'I'm 80 years old and still playing rugby'
item.description: At 80 years old, Ian Cunningham is one of the oldest walking rugby players in the UK.

item.title: Olympics: 'The Taliban wouldn’t let me cycle because I’m a woman'
item.description: Masomah had to flee the Taliban in Afghanistan because she wanted to ride her bike. Now she's part of a team nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize and hopes to compete in the Olympics.

item.title: 'I thought strokes only happened to elderly people'
item.description: Three young stroke survivors share their stories to help raise awareness.

item.title: ICYMI: Nine babies and a giant squid
item.description: A surprise delivery for a mum in Morocco and questionable spending in Japan - news you may have missed.

item.title: Son wins father's Bradford council seat after Covid death
item.description: Mohsin Hussain, 26, said he wanted to carry on his father's legacy.

item.title: 'Our first day of freedom on American soil'
item.description: Adrian Meza and his family from Nicaragua have just been released from detention by US border officials.

item.title: #MeToo Serbia: 'I thought I was the only one'
item.description: Balkan women are sharing their sexual assault stories after Serbian actress Milena Radulovic went public with hers.

item.title: Sophie Scholl: Student who resisted Hitler and inspires Germany
item.description: Germany marks the 100th anniversary of the birth of Sophie Scholl, who was killed defying the Nazis.

item.title: Junior doctors in India's Covid crisis: 'We've grown up really fast'
item.description: Covid cases in Pankti's home state increased eight-fold in her first month as a medical intern.

item.title: Joe Ligon: America's 'longest juvenile lifer' on 68 years in prison
item.description: After waiting seven decades for freedom, Joe Ligon tells the BBC how he intends to spend the rest of his days.

item.title: Akala: Why we need more black, working class period drama
item.description: Akala speaks to Radio 1 Newsbeat about filling the gaps in historical fiction.

item.title: The 'smart and cheeky' Aboriginal boy teaching Australia a lesson
item.description: A film about an Aboriginal boy's experience of school shines a light on Australia's failure to give all children a fair start.

item.title: The misinformation bubble threatening Brazil's indigenous people
item.description: Health workers report resistance because of fake content spread over WhatsApp.

item.title: Spy row revs up Czech-Russian tensions
item.description: The Czechs and Russians, ex-communist bloc allies, are in a new diplomatic Cold War.

item.title: India's Covid crisis delivers a blow to brand Modi
item.description: Narendra Modi's carefully crafted image has taken a hit as India reels from a punishing Covid wave.

item.title: Superb Alvarez stops Saunders to unify super-middleweight titles
item.description: Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez stops Billy Joe Saunders in the eighth round in Texas to unify the super-middleweight titles.

item.title: ‘He never scored them in training’ - Aguero and Man City’s Panenka pain
item.description: Sergio Aguero misses a penalty after attempting a Panenka-style spot-kick during Manchester City's defeat by Chelsea.

item.title: 2021 elections: What are the results in my area?
item.description: National elections in Scotland and Wales and local elections in England took place on 6 May 2021.

item.title: Sir John Curtice: What the 2021 election results mean for the parties
item.description: Prof Sir John Curtice says the ruling parties appear to have done well in Thursday's bumper crop of elections.

item.title: Scottish election 2021: Results in maps and charts
item.description: The picture across Scotland as the SNP win a fourth consecutive victory in the Scottish Parliament.

item.title: Welsh election results 2021: What's the secret behind Labour's success?
item.description: Labour's fortunes in Wales seem a world away from its troubles in England, what's going on?

item.title: Elections results 2021: Andy Burnham re-elected as Greater Manchester mayor
item.description: The Greater Manchester Mayor is the bookmakers' favourite to become the next Labour leader.

item.title: Elections 2021: Labour insiders on Starmer, what went wrong and how to fix it
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer took charge of Labour a year ago and has faced his first challenge at the polls.

item.title: Scottish election results: The story so far
item.description: The key results and moments from the first day of counting in the Holyrood election.

item.title: Election results 2021: When will we know who has won?
item.description: There could be a long wait for some results this year.

item.title: Elections 2021: How to follow the results on the BBC
item.description: Find out how to keep up to date with live election results on TV, radio, online and on social media.

item.title: What to expect in Scottish election
item.description: Scots have cast their votes, but they will not be counted until Friday and Saturday - when will the outcome be known?

item.title: Which countries are on the green list for foreign holidays?
item.description: A new "traffic light" system for travel classifies countries as green, amber or red.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 35 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: UK holidays: When and where can I go.... and who with?
item.description: The rules on having a holiday in the UK have been relaxed - but restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Northern Ireland is the latest part of the UK to lift some of the restrictions designed to stop the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the plans for the NHS app?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules and the rule of six?
item.description: Rules on hugging and social distancing in England are being reviewed.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: Covid: What refund rights are there for holidays abroad?
item.description: Quarantine-free overseas holidays will be possible after 17 May, but what rights do you have if plans or rules change?

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.
